participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

EATQ_02.LongName: When angry at someone, says things s/he knows will hurt that person's feelings.

EATQ_03.LongName: Has a hard time finishing things on time.

EATQ_04.LongName: Thinks traveling to Africa or India would be exciting and fun.

EATQ_05.LongName: If having a problem with someone, usually tries to deal with it right away.

EATQ_06.LongName: Has a hard time waiting his/her turn to speak when excited.

EATQ_07.LongName: Often does not seem to enjoy things as much as his/her friends.

EATQ_08.LongName: Opens presents before s/he is supposed to.

EATQ_9.LongName: Would be frightened by the thought of skiing fast down a steep slope.

EATQ_10.LongName: Feels like crying over very little on some days.

EATQ_11.LongName: If very angry, might hit someone.

EATQ_12.LongName: Likes taking care of other people.

EATQ_13.LongName: Likes to be able to share his/her private thoughts with someone else.

EATQ_14.LongName: Usually does something fun for awhile before starting her/his homework, even though s/he is not supposed to.

EATQ_15.LongName: Finds it easy to really concentrate on a problem.

EATQ_16.LongName: Thinks it would be exciting to move to a new city.

EATQ_17.LongName: When asked to do something, does it right away, even if s/he doesn't want to.

EATQ_18.LongName: Would like to be able to spend time with a good friend every day.

EATQ_19.LongName: Tends to be rude to people s/he doesn't like.

EATQ_20.LongName: Is annoyed by little things other kids do.

EATQ_21.LongName: Gets very irritated when someone criticizes her/him.

EATQ_22.LongName: When interrupted or distracted, forgets what s/he was about to say.

EATQ_23.LongName: Is more likely to do something s/he shouldn't do the more s/he tries to stop her/himself.

EATQ_24.LongName: Enjoys exchanging hugs with people s/he likes.

EATQ_25.LongName: Tends to try to blame mistakes on someone else.

EATQ_26.LongName: Is sad more often than other people realize.

EATQ_27.LongName: Can generally think of something to say, even with strangers.

EATQ_28.LongName: Wouldn't be afraid to try a risky sport like deep sea diving.

EATQ_29.LongName: Expresses a desire to travel to exotic places when s/he hears about them.

EATQ_30.LongName: Worries about our family when s/he is not with us.

EATQ_31.LongName: Gets irritated when I will not take her/him someplace s/he wants to go.

EATQ_33.LongName: Is hardly ever sad, even when lots of things are going wrong.

EATQ_34.LongName: Would like driving a racing car.

EATQ_35.LongName: Has a difficult time tuning out background noise and concentrating when trying to study.

EATQ_36.LongName: Usually finishes her/his homework before it's due.

EATQ_37.LongName: Likes it when something exciting and different happens at school.

EATQ_38.LongName: Usually gets started right away on difficult assignments.

EATQ_39.LongName: Is good at keeping track of several different things that are happening around her/him.

EATQ_40.LongName: Is energized by being in large crowds of people.

EATQ_41.LongName: Makes fun of how other people look.

EATQ_43.LongName: Wants to have close relationships with other people.

EATQ_45.LongName: Gets irritated when s/he has to stop doing something s/he is enjoying.

EATQ_46.LongName: Usually puts off working on a project until it is due.

EATQ_47.LongName: Is able to stop him/herself from laughing at inappropriate times.

EATQ_48.LongName: Is afraid of the idea of me dying or leaving her/him.

EATQ_49.LongName: Is often in the middle of doing one thing and then goes off to do something else without finishing it.

EATQ_51.LongName: Is quite a warm and friendly person.

EATQ_52.LongName: Sometimes seems sad even when s/he should be enjoying her/himself like at Christmas, or on a trip.

EATQ_53.LongName: Doesn't enjoy playing softball or baseball because s/he is afraid of the ball.

EATQ_55.LongName: Feels scared when entering a darkened room at night.

EATQ_56.LongName: Wouldn't want to go on the frightening rides at the fair.

EATQ_57.LongName: Hates it when people don't agree with him/her.

EATQ_58.LongName: Gets very frustrated when s/he makes a mistake in her/his school work.

EATQ_59.LongName: Is usually able to stick with his/her plans and goals.

EATQ_60.LongName: Pays close attention when someone tells her/him how to do something.

EATQ_62.LongName: Feels shy about meeting new people.

EATQ_63.Description: Average score of items 5, 17, 36, 38 and reverse scores of items 3,14, and 46. A higher score reflects greater capacity to perform an action when there is a strong tendency to avoid it. | Calculation = (revscore([EATQ_03]) + [EATQ_05] + revscore([EATQ_14]) + [EATQ_17] + [EATQ_36] + [EATQ_38] + revscore([EATQ_46])) / (iif( [EATQ_03] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_05] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_14] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_17] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_36] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_38] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_46] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_64.Description: Average score of items 12, 13, 18, 24, 43, and 51. A higher score reflects greater desire for warmth and closeness with others, independent of shyness or extraversion. | Calculation = ([EATQ_12] + [EATQ_13] + [EATQ_18] + [EATQ_24] + [EATQ_43] + [EATQ_51]) / (iif( [EATQ_12] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_13] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_18] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_24] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_43] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_51] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_65.Description: Average score of items 2, 11, 19, 32, 25 and 41 and reverse score of item 42. A higher score reflects more hostile and aggressive actions, including person- and object-directed physical violence, direct and indirect verbal aggression, and hostile reactivity. | Calculation = ([EATQ_02] + [EATQ_11] + [EATQ_19] + [EATQ_32] + revscore([EATQ_42]) + [EATQ_25] + [EATQ_41]) / (iif( [EATQ_02] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_11] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_19] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_32] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_42] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_25] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_41] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_66.Description: Average scores of items 15, 39, 60 and reverse scores of items 22, 35, and 49. A higher score reflects greater capacity to focus attention as well as to shift attention when desired. | Calculation = ([EATQ_15] + revscore([EATQ_22]) + revscore([EATQ_35]) + [EATQ_39] + revscore([EATQ_49]) + [EATQ_60]) / (iif( [EATQ_15] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_22] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_35] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_39] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_49] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_60] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_67.Description: Average scores of items 7, 10, 26, and 52 and reverse score of item 33. A higher score reflects more unpleasant affect and lowered mood, loss of enjoyment and interest in activities. | Calculation = ([EATQ_07] + [EATQ_10] + [EATQ_26] + revscore([EATQ_33]) + [EATQ_52]) / (iif( [EATQ_07] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_10] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_26] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_33] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_52] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_68.Description: Average score of items 1, 30, 48, 53, 55 and 61. A higher score reflects more unpleasant affect related to anticipation of distress. | Calculation = ([EATQ_01] + [EATQ_30] + [EATQ_48] + [EATQ_53] + [EATQ_55] + [EATQ_61]) / (iif( [EATQ_01] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_30] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_48] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_53] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_55] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_61] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_69.Description: Average score of items 20, 21, 31, 45, 57, and 58. A higher score reflects more negative affect related to interruption of ongoing tasks or goal blocking. | Calculation = ([EATQ_20] + [EATQ_21] + [EATQ_31] + [EATQ_45] + [EATQ_57] + [EATQ_58]) / (iif( [EATQ_20] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_21] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_31] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_45] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_57] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_58] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_70.Description: Average score of items 47 and 49 and reverse scores of items 6, 8 and 23. Higher score reflects greater capacity to plan, and to suppress inappropriate responses. | Calculation = (revscore([EATQ_06]) + revscore([EATQ_08]) + revscore([EATQ_23]) + [EATQ_47] + [EATQ_59]) / (iif( [EATQ_06] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_08] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_23] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_47] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_59] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_71.Description: Average score of items 44, 62 and reverse scores of 27, 50, and 54. A higher score reflects greater behavioral inhibition to novelty and challenge, especially social. | Calculation = (revscore([EATQ_27]) + [EATQ_44] + revscore([EATQ_50]) + revscore([EATQ_54]) + [EATQ_62]) / (iif( [EATQ_27] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_44] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_50] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_54] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_62] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_72.Description: Average score of items 4, 16, 28, 29, 34, 37, and 40 and reverse score of items 9 and 56. A higher score reflects greater pleasure derived from activities involving high intensity or novelty. | Calculation = ([EATQ_04] + revscore([EATQ_9]) + [EATQ_16] + [EATQ_28] + [EATQ_29] + [EATQ_34] + [EATQ_37] + [EATQ_40] + revscore([EATQ_56])) / (iif( [EATQ_04] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_9] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_16] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_28] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_29] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_34] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_37] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_40] > 0, 1, 0) + iif( [EATQ_56] > 0, 1, 0))

EATQ_73.Description: Factor scores are calculated by calculating the mean of subscale scores from attention, inhibitory control, and activation control. | Calculation = ([EATQ_66]+[EATQ_70]+[EATQ_63])/3

EATQ_74.Description: Factor scores are calculated by calculating the mean of subscale scores from attention, inhibitory control, and activation control. | Calculation = ([EATQ_72] + (5-[EATQ_68]) + (5-[EATQ_71]))/3

EATQ_75.Description: Factor scores are calculated by calculating the mean of subscale scores from frustration, depressive mood and aggression. | Calculation = ([EATQ_69] + [EATQ_67] + [EATQ_65])/3

EATQ_76.Description: While the self-report form contains three scales that are combined to create “Affiliativeness”, the parent report only contains the “Affiliation” scale (EATQ_64), which does not load onto other superscales/factors. | Calculation = [EATQ_64]
